title: City wage subsidy harms rural workers

content.prompt: Businesses employ workers from city neighborhoods and rural areas. These workers are perfect substitutes and cannot relocate in the short run. The government offers businesses a wage subsidy if they hire workers from city neighborhoods. What is the effect of the subsidy on the wage rate of rural workers and on the total hours they work?

choices.label:
Wage Rate of Rural WorkersTotal Hours Worked by Rural Workers
IncreaseDecrease

Wage Rate of Rural Workers Total Hours Worked by Rural Workers
No change No change

Wage Rate of Rural WorkersTotal Hours Worked by Rural Workers
No changeDecrease

Wage Rate of Rural WorkersTotal Hours Worked by Rural Workers
DecreaseDecrease

Wage Rate of Rural WorkersTotal Hours Worked by Rural Workers
DecreaseNo change

topic.text: 5.2: Changes in Factor Demand and Factor Supply

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine the effect(s) of one or more changes on other economic markets.
